raw_text:
Vibe awards back despite violence
 
 The US Vibe awards will be held again next year despite a stabbing which happened during the ceremony.
 
 Vibe magazine president Kenard Gibbs said the attack earlier this month in Santa Monica was "sickening". He said not holding the awards would be counter to the work the magazine has done to promote hip hop music. Rapper Young Buck has been charged after allegedly stabbing a man who hit Dr Dre as he was about to receive a lifetime achievement award.
 
 The rapper, whose real name is David Darnell Brown, is due in court on 20 December after being arrested on one charge of attempted murder and a second charge of assault with a deadly weapon. The performer is one of the members of 50 Cent's G-Unit group, which is signed to Dr Dre's record label. The man who was stabbed, Jimmy James Johnson, suffered a collapsed lung and is in a stable condition at a Los Angeles hospital. Mr Johnson allegedly approached Dr Dre, who was seated at a table in front of the stage, and appeared to ask for an autograph before punching him. During the ensuing scuffle - which involved many of the 1,000-strong crowd - Mr Johnson was stabbed as he was being dragged away by security staff,

<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text concisely while preserving key ideas and details. Let me start by reading through it carefully.

The first sentence talks about the US Vibe awards being held again despite a stabbing in Santa Monica. The magazine president, Kenard Gibbs, called the incident "sickening." Then, he mentions that not holding the awards would be counter to promoting hip hop music. A rapper named David Darnell Brown is charged with murder and assault.

He's due on December 20 for court charges, got arrested from January to October. He's a member of G-Unit group for Dr Dre, signed by his label. Jimmy James Johnson was stabbed while approaching Dr Dre, who was sitting at the stage and looking for an autograph. Security pulled him away when he was being dragged away.

So, key points are: US Vibe awards again because of the stabbing, Gibbs calls it sickening, mentions the impact on promoting hip-hop music by not holding awards, rapper is charged with murder and assault, due in court next year, currently serving time, part of G-Unit for Dr Dre, has an injury after being stabbed.

I need to make sure I capture all these elements without adding extra details. Let me structure this into a concise summary.
</think>

The US Vibe awards will once again be held despite a stabbing incident in Santa Monica. The magazine president, Kenard Gibbs, described the situation as "sickening." He stressed that stopping the event would not be conducive to promoting hip-hop music. A rapper named David Darnell Brown is charged with murder and assault, due in court on December 20. He's a member of Dr Dre's G-Unit group and is one of his former members. Jimmy James Johnson was stabbed while near Dr Dre, who was seated at the stage looking for an autograph. Security intervened when he was being dragged away.

The performance artist is one of Dr Dre's label members and is scheduled to appear at the awards ceremony next year, although it remains unclear if he will be present due to the ongoing case against him.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The US Vibe Awards will be held next year despite the violence that occurred during this month's ceremony. The event was scheduled to take place on November 26th but has been rescheduled for the 5th of February due to security concerns and the need to ensure a safe environment for all attendees. Vibe magazine president Kenard Gibbs announced that there will be no disruption to this year's awards, emphasizing the importance of promoting hip-hop music and supporting artists.
